blog.name: the-sunflower-samurai
blog.title: In The Land of Forever Shit

tags: if this sounds like me wailing on the corpse of molly....it kinda is?
this is based entirely on my conjecture about the purpose of the character and his intended development
summary: After watching Talks last night.... [[MORE]] Something Taliesin said confirmed some of my suspicions about Molly as a character....
body:
After watching Talks last night….

Something Taliesin said confirmed some of my suspicions about Molly as a character.

Early on in the campaign, Taliesin compared Molly to Percy by saying that, unlike the latter, Molly was not a tortured soul. He already had his crisis, he’s not broken, “he’s fine.” 

Time and again, Taliesin talked about his character as someone who was emotionally steady. Nothing got under his skin. He didn’t care about other people’s baggage so long as it didn’t hurt anyone. He was interested specifically in experience and novelty and pleasure. Everything else was superfluous.

That’s all good and fine, but I also think there’s something troubling about “not caring” about another person’s baggage if that baggage is, in fact, important to the person. There’s something troubling about never risking your heart or becoming invested in the people around you for any other reason than “they’re people.” 

We often characterize trauma in the way it manifests in people like Caleb: self-loathing, paranoia, emotional numbness, fixating on the past; but it can also manifest like how it does in Molly: hyper-presentness, never digging below the surface, living your life in a way that offers all of the thrills and none of the vulnerability. If you don’t care deeply, nothing can ever be taken away from you. You’ll never have to contemplate how once upon a time, you lost everything. You’ll never have to worry about the same thing happening again. 

Molly seemed like a happy person, but a terribly, terribly empty one.

I assumed this was going to be his conflict. Molly would be forced to be vulnerable. He’d finally have to grow up and realize that half the spice of life is knowing that you could lose everyone and everything (again).

But the way Taliesin talked about Molly blew that out of the water. First, he said, “there was never going to be a profound change in Molly,” and pointed out that the character was always meant to be defined by the impression he left on other people: 

“There’s a way of living a life where you don’t give a fuck about what people think but you do give a fuck about people. He never needed to be fixed and he never needed permission for anything. He’s not Iron Man where you’re waiting to see him become a good person, and he was never a creature of profound change like Captain America, where you watch to see the good they make on the world; his unfinished business was in each interaction he had with the people in the world and making them deal with him, but making sure that dealing with him was always a positive and kind experience.”

That sounds….deathly boring for a character. Nice for a person, but terrible for fiction. If a character never changes then why are we watching them? To see how good and pure they are? Because I never got the impression that Molly actually cared about anyone. He cared about them as people, yes, but as an idea of people–an abstraction. That way of interacting with the world says a lot less about empathy and true connection than it does about ego and narcissism.

Because, as much as we’re told about how good Molly is, I never felt the other members of the M9 felt that positively about him. Suspicious, maybe, and definitely confused, but not warm. His gestures of supposed kindness often fell flat, because there was rarely any real curiosity about the other person’s well-being behind them. I keep thinking about how, after the group ganged up on Nott and raked her over the coals for Caleb’s actions, Molly gave her a coin. “There’s an extra platinum in there.” 

Nott rightly called it out for the patronizing bullshit it was later. “Oh, and an extra platinum, as if that’ s supposed to smooth things over.” Every supposed gesture of goodwill afterwards just seemed like Molly was a person who understood how to make himself feel good but knew nothing of the hard work and vulnerability required of true kindness.

Which could have been great! That could have been his flaw. Like, hey, Molly, we know you’re a follower of the god of lies, but maybe try some direct honesty for a change? I doubt these highwaymen whose leader we incinerated and forced to take off their pants gave much of a shit that you slipped them some money after the fact. It was weirdly manipulative. While we’re at it, can we talk about your kneejerk reaction of mind controlling people? 

I don’t know. It could be he will back next week, or the week after, or never. There’s no way of knowing the character he might have become. It could be I’m reading too much into Taliesin’s words, or that his words confirmed a bias I’ve had against the character for a long time.

If I’m not reading too much into it, though….maybe it’s a good thing Tal is making a new character. Because the idea of a character who never changes, but we’re told over and over again is supposed to be good and moral and kind, but rarely exemplifies real kindness and honesty, is more than just a bore: he’s insufferable.

blog.description: Welcome to the blog!  You can call me jakia / jak, hence the lucky bit. :3Occasionally I write fanfiction and blog about things I love. I'm an asexual university instructor. I have lots of ideas and little motivation. My ask box is always open, and feel...

tags: i am told both vax and scanlan get better
as character development is a thing
but right now i'm just annoyed as heck with them both
summary:
inthannon replied to your post:
                    oh man. What a good episode. There is so, so much...                
    I’m...
body:
inthannon replied to your post: oh man. What a good episode. There is so, so much…
I’m still stubbornly making my way through Vox Machina before venturing to the Mighty Nein..Been thinking about starting to watch the second campaign just to catch up so I can watch it live while catching up. :D

I’m doing the opposite! I binge watched my way through campaign 2 and am now fully caught up on live episodes, while sloooowwwly backtracking my way through campaign 1. 

Personally I like the characters more in campaign 2, but I’m hoping the characters of c1 grow on me as the story develops. I genuinely love all the characters of c2–whoever is currently on screen is likely my favorite. C1? I like Percy, I think, and Pike is adorable, and everyone else is sort of a hit or miss with me. I haven’t liked Vax or Scanlan much so far, which is surprising because Caleb??? Nott??? Those are my favorite two!!! 

ACTING, MAN. WOW, THEY ARE GOOD AT IT.

summary: Critical Role ep 102
body:
Critical Role ep 102

Delilah just turned Vax to dust. Her revenge on Keyleth is complete. And I’m definitely crying. Like, how can you bring someone back from a pile of dust?

reblog.comment:
Critical Role ep 102

Delilah just turned Vax to dust. Her revenge on Keyleth is complete. And I’m definitely crying. Like, how can you bring someone back from a pile of dust?

trail.content_raw:
Critical Role ep 102

Delilah just turned Vax to dust. Her revenge on Keyleth is complete. And I’m definitely crying. Like, how can you bring someone back from a pile of dust?
trail.content:
Critical Role ep 102

Delilah just turned Vax to dust. Her revenge on Keyleth is complete. And I’m definitely crying. Like, how can you bring someone back from a pile of dust?

tags: ive seen people say some vile shit this week
summary: Late take: Mollymauk dying sucks, because I liked him a lot (despite all my talking about how the character from a gameplay...
body:
Late take:

Mollymauk dying sucks, because I liked him a lot (despite all my talking about how the character from a gameplay standpoint is awful), but death is a part of D&D. That’s just facts.
And if they had a way of bringing him back, sure. Bring his ass back. But they don’t, and frothing at the mouth and sending Matt hate for not Deus Ex Machina-ing a solution to this problem is honestly a new low for this community and that’s the tea.

Matt (and me) have an attitude to the game where the players are most definitely not the most powerful things around, and sometimes you fall ass-first into some shit that you most definitely can’t handle. But it’s not like the game forbids running away, which is exactly what they should have done. They knew the fight wasn’t going well, and between Nott doing nothing for most of the fight, Keg doing nothing for most of the fight and Cone of Cold being a real thing, M9 should have left way the fuck earlier.

At the end of the day, it was a dirty, ugly encounter where nothing went the way we wanted it to, but honestly? The players made bad calls and rolled some shit dice, and insulting/threatening Matt for that is the type of shit that makes me regret the increase in Critical Role community size. Characters die. It sucks, but it happens. Sometimes it can be fixed, but this time it can’t.
Take a deep breath, log off social media and get the fuck over it.

she always manages to unhinge me.

summary: there’ll be no more after me
title: there’ll be no more after me
body:
read it on ao3

SPOILERS FOR CRITICAL ROLE CAMPAIGN 2 EPISODE 26

Summary: mollymauk tealeaf is dead. he waits, alone in the dark, for something to happen.
Eventually, something does happen. His family comes to say goodbye. 

a/n: the title is from Deuteronomy 2:10 by the mountain goats. this is mostly me getting closure and telling Beau i love her 

Mollymauk Tealeaf does not like to be alone. Mollymauk Tealeaf does not like the dark. So, when he opens his eyes to find himself alone and in total darkness, it’s disorienting to say the least. He fights back the panic by closing his eyes and going over what he knows, for sure.

He knows he is Mollymauk Tealeaf. He knows he has friends, they’re waiting for him somewhere. Why were they waiting? He knows something is wrong. He knows he shouldn’t be where he is, and yet it feels familiar somehow.

The darkness around him doesn’t change. For hours, he sits(is he sitting? It feels more like floating), trying to remember everything. He remembers chasing something, he remembers Keg, he remembers a plan, and a fight, and Lorenzo. And then it hits him.

Mollymauk Tealeaf is dead.

He laughs when he realizes it. He doesn’t know why. He thought he’d be afraid or sad or angry when it finally came. But all he can think about is how funny it is, how poetically Mollymauk it is for him to have died the way he did.

Eventually, the laughter fades. And all that’s left is an overwhelming sense of “What now?”. This can’t be his afterlife, it was so boring.

Nothing happens, for a bit. And then he hears it.

“Molly?” a timid, shrill voice penetrates the silence. He turns around, and he sees Nott, sitting anxiously and holding her flask as she speaks, her eyes fixated on the body lying next to her. Molly’s body. “I don’t know if you can hear me, but… I wanted to say thank you. I feel like I never told you that. But you were nice to me and you made me laugh and now, you’re gone, and I really miss you, and I’m sorry i never told you before.” Molly smiles, and he kneels down next to Nott and puts a hand on her face. He wipes away a tear that falls down her face, and presses a gentle kiss to her forehead. He doesn’t know if she can feel it, but it’s all he can do to comfort her. After a moment, she takes a swig of her flask, and disappears as she stands up.

It’s only a moment before Caleb appears instead, a somber look on his face. He’s kneeling next to Molly’s body, and he takes one of Molly’s hands and grips it tightly. He doesn’t say anything for a moment. Then he clears his throat and begins, his voice hoarse and tired.

“I’m no good with words, Mollymauk, you know that.” He hesitates for a moment. “I don’t know what to say to you. You always do that, you know. I. I don’t know what I’m going to do without you, Mollymauk.”  Caleb falls down to his knees as tears start rolling down his face. Molly wraps his arms around Caleb, holding him tightly and fiercely.

They stay like that for a few moments, and then Mollymauk pulls away before pressing a kiss to Caleb’s forehead, as he did for Nott. Caleb wipes his eyes, and stands up, turning and beginning to walk away.

Before he disappears, he turns back and says “Goodbye, Mollymauk. I am sorry we cannot bring you back.”

A few moments pass in the darkness. And then he sees Beau. She looks exhausted, still covered in blood from the battle. Her eyes are red and angry, and he knows she’s trying so hard not to cry. She sighs and sits down next to him, running her hands over the patterns on his coat.

“Why’d you have to do that, asshole?” She said, her voice shaky. “You can’t just leave like that. We need you. Fjord, Jester, Yasha, they need you to come rescue them. Caleb needs you, Nott needs you.” Her voice gets quiet as she hesitates, and her next sentence is barely a whisper. “I need you.” As she says it, she curls in on herself, her hands balling into fists clinging to his jacket. He can see her shaking with tears, and he puts a hand on her back as she cries. Through her sobs, she starts muttering, talking more than she usually does, as if she’s trying to get out every thought as soon as it comes through her mind.

“I’m sorry I wasn’t able to protect you. How are we gonna get them back without you, Molly?”

“You’ll be okay,” he whispers. “You’re a strong girl, you’ll figure something out.”

“I don’t know if I’m strong enough for this,” she says, almost as if she could hear him. She stayed there for a little bit, her forehead resting on Molly’s bodies chest, her hands holding tightly onto his coat.

“I love you, Mollymauk,” she said quietly, hoarsely, like she was confessing a secret to him. “You’re my family.”

“I love you too,” he whispers back to her as she sits up. She starts to get up, but pauses for a moment. She runs her hand over his coat once more, and she begins to take it off of him.

“I hope you don’t mind if I borrow this for a little bit,” she says. “I’ll bring it back, mostly. I promise.” Then she got up and left, taking the coat with her.

What the hell does she mean by ‘mostly’? Mollymauk wondered.

It wasn’t very long before she came back. When she did, he noticed the hem was shorter, and it looked messily torn. And then he saw the fabric tied around her waist, the familiar and ostentatious patterns contrasting the rest of her fairly simple outfit.

“I’m sorry,” she said, putting the cloak back on him. “I just wanted to, y’know, keep part of you with me. A souvenir, I guess.” He smiled.

“You look great.” He didn’t know if she could hear him. He kind of hoped she couldn’t, he couldn’t let this asshole hear him complementing her, gods no.

She sat there for a moment, not saying anything. She just looked at him, exhausted and sad and lonely. He kneeled next to her and pressed a kiss into her forehead.

“Fuck you, Mollymauk,” She said, laughing softly, trying hard not to cry again.

“Fuck you too, Beauregard.”

“Goodbye.”

“Goodbye.” And, after a moment. “Good luck. Kill those bastards for me.”

Summary: mollymauk tealeaf is dead. he waits, alone in the dark, for something to happen.
Eventually, something does happen. His family comes to say goodbye. 

a/n: the title is from Deuteronomy 2:10 by the mountain goats. this is mostly me getting closure and telling Beau i love her 

Mollymauk Tealeaf does not like to be alone. Mollymauk Tealeaf does not like the dark. So, when he opens his eyes to find himself alone and in total darkness, it’s disorienting to say the least. He fights back the panic by closing his eyes and going over what he knows, for sure.

He knows he is Mollymauk Tealeaf. He knows he has friends, they’re waiting for him somewhere. Why were they waiting? He knows something is wrong. He knows he shouldn’t be where he is, and yet it feels familiar somehow.

The darkness around him doesn’t change. For hours, he sits(is he sitting? It feels more like floating), trying to remember everything. He remembers chasing something, he remembers Keg, he remembers a plan, and a fight, and Lorenzo. And then it hits him.

Eventually, the laughter fades. And all that’s left is an overwhelming sense of “What now?”. This can’t be his afterlife, it was so boring.

“Molly?” a timid, shrill voice penetrates the silence. He turns around, and he sees Nott, sitting anxiously and holding her flask as she speaks, her eyes fixated on the body lying next to her. But you were nice to me and you made me laugh and now, you’re gone, and I really miss you, and I’m sorry i never told you before.” Molly smiles, and he kneels down next to Nott and puts a hand on her face. He wipes away a tear that falls down her face, and presses a gentle kiss to her forehead. He doesn’t know if she can feel it, but it’s all he can do to comfort her. After a moment, she takes a swig of her flask, and disappears as she stands up.

I don’t know what I’m going to do without you, Mollymauk.”  Caleb falls down to his knees as tears start rolling down his face. Molly wraps his arms around Caleb, holding him tightly and fiercely.

They stay like that for a few moments, and then Mollymauk pulls away before pressing a kiss to Caleb’s forehead, as he did for Nott. Caleb wipes his eyes, and stands up, turning and beginning to walk away.

Before he disappears, he turns back and says “Goodbye, Mollymauk. I am sorry we cannot bring you back.”

A few moments pass in the darkness. And then he sees Beau. She looks exhausted, still covered in blood from the battle. Her eyes are red and angry, and he knows she’s trying so hard not to cry. She sighs and sits down next to him, running her hands over the patterns on his coat.

“Why’d you have to do that, asshole?” She said, her voice shaky. “You can’t just leave like that. We need you. Fjord, Jester, Yasha, they need you to come rescue them. Caleb needs you, Nott needs you.” Her voice gets quiet as she hesitates, and her next sentence is barely a whisper. “I need you.” As she says it, she curls in on herself, her hands balling into fists clinging to his jacket. He can see her shaking with tears, and he puts a hand on her back as she cries. “I’m sorry I wasn’t able to protect you. How are we gonna get them back without you, Molly?”

“I don’t know if I’m strong enough for this,” she says, almost as if she could hear him. She stayed there for a little bit, her forehead resting on Molly’s bodies chest, her hands holding tightly onto his coat.

summary: I'm kind of screaming into the void here but if after last night's talks machina and witnessing three adult men and two adult...
body: I’m kind of screaming into the void here but if after last night’s talks machina and witnessing three adult men and two adult women cry/become teary eyed over a d&d character passing, and you are still floating that critical role has some anti gay conspiracy , I can only shake my head in disbelief.

summary: Here’s a thought.
body:
Here’s a thought.

What if, at some point down the line, maybe at the epilogue or something, Caleb is now this all-powerful reality bending wizard with access to ninth level spells and the first thing he does with that power is cast Wish to bring Mollymauk back?

blog.title: Yes I like Pina Coladas!!!
blog.description: French, bi, 25, Warlock, chaotic good (apparently), Ravenclaw, Thunderbird, INTJ (or INFP) performer in a musical theatre group. Messy blog, just like my mind and my bedroom.💗💜💙

summary: Critical Role ep 102
body:
Critical Role ep 102

So Vex is dead while Vax watches that happen, frozen by a spell. I’m okay you guys. I’m okay.



I’m not okay.

blog.name: brisatmoscrew
blog.title: The Epilogue
blog.description:
Hello everyone! I'm Bri. I'm WolvenSpirit on FlightRising, and this is more or less my personal blog (of the many I have left behind). I also have information available for Saress Esaraa, my fantroll who I'm starting to roleplay as again on here.
Any NSFW content, as unlikely as it is to be here, will be tagged accordingly, and I'm currently 23. She/her.

tags: this could have been so much worse
summary:
Oh god imagine if it had been a TPK...
I'm gonna miss Molly, but if we'd lost everyone... We'd have met a whole slew of new...
body:
Oh god imagine if it had been a TPK…

I’m gonna miss Molly, but if we’d lost everyone… We’d have met a whole slew of new people and then have to see Fjord, Jester and Yasha go looking for their friends and finding them dead…

reblog.comment:
Oh god imagine if it had been a TPK…

I’m gonna miss Molly, but if we’d lost everyone… We’d have met a whole slew of new people and then have to see Fjord, Jester and Yasha go looking for their friends and finding them dead…

summary: HE BLEEDS NEON
title: HE BLEEDS NEON
body:
His teeth flash against the artificial lights, too sharp, too jagged, too bestial in nature. You are scared, but still he smiles.

His body twirls and dances for the audience, captivating. You’ve seen this particular dance before, but this is different. Now, it’s smooth and elegant, with a soft smile that betrays his smugness for he knows in that moment he is perfect. The way you usually have seen it is more violent. The blades dancing about him, all movements sharp and powerful, his eyes filled with absolute bloodlust.

He bleeds neon. He bleeds confetti and glitter and laughter.

He bleeds ice. He bleeds destruction. He is nothing more than the blood he bleeds.

You get used to seeing him bleed, it’s how he lives, on the field of battle and off it.

But then one day you see him bleed and the look on his face is none of those things. It’s equal parts scared and calm, the face of a man who doesn’t fully understand what is to come but that he will accept it, whatever it may be. He bleeds and bleeds and bleeds and you scream and cry to make him stop but he doesn’t.

The boy who lived his life bleeding dies just the very same.

And oh lord, how the sun bows it’s mighty head at his passing.

***

Mollymauk Tealeaf… you will be missed

tags: tbh though molly probably wouldn’t mind being rolled up in a carpet to be buried
it would make for a lot of confusion/questions for whoever found him
summary: This entire time, whenever Molly’s tapestry has been brought up I’ve always imagined it being bulky and thick like an area rug...
body:
This entire time, whenever Molly’s tapestry has been brought up I’ve always imagined it being bulky and thick like an area rug or something, like the tapestries that used to be hung in old castles and that he was just hefting it around everywhere.

When Tal mentioned Molly walking into the bedroom draped in the tapestry, I just pictured him walking in with basically a carpet over his shoulders.

When people said the M9 should bury him wrapped up in the tapestry, I pictured his body rolled up in a carpet like it’s an episode of 48 Hours.

It just hit me today that the cast (and probably literally everyone else) likely mean the thinner and lighter, almost sheet-like tapestries like you see hanging in peoples’ bedrooms.

In short, I’m fucking dumb thanks for your time.
